intro: Sarcostigma angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sarcostigma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, shrub-like plant characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain several seeds. Sarcostigma angustifolium is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth.
